Nelson Mandela once said this : “ If you speak with a person in the language he understands , you reach his mind . ”

This shows impressively that we cannot rely only on the English language if we are to build relationships and trust with people from other countries .

68 percent of students who have studied foreign languages have reached Higher grade A .

A 2014 British Employment and Qualifications Commission survey found that 17 % of the reasons why employers had difficulty filling jobs were attributable to a lack of language knowledge .

These capabilities are essential in a globalised world , given more promising employment opportunities that language requires .

When children learn to speak several languages – particularly those of developing countries – they will later have a better chance of finding meaningful employment in the labour market .
The schools in Scotland differ in their language supply .
Some schools focus on classical modern languages , while other languages that are most important for Britain in 2020 , such as Mandarin or Japanese , will be taught .
Whatever your child is interested , there will always be a number of languages in independent schools , with teachers specialized in this field .
Independent schools in Scotland want to offer a learning environment that is well prepared for children , and to be given the necessary tools for their success , whatever the future may bring .
In today ’ s global business , languages remain undeniably important for the country ’ s future , and that must also be reflected in education .
